result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony D Felske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd) [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 11/02/2015 and each month thereafter or penalty of 28 days jail, consecutive for non-payment.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Brookfield Police Dept. Costs to be paid along with fine payments.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

With Huber. Release for standard conditions. Defendant to report to Waukesha County Huber by 10/16/15 by 8pm. Defendant already in Milwaukee County Huber. This sentence may be transferred to Milwaukee County.
Concurrent with: Milwaukee County Sentence
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Perform Alcohol Assessment. 
Attend Victim Impact Panel Meeting on 11/18/2015 or serve penalty of 30 days Huber, consecutive for non-attendance.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Anthony D Felske in court with Attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Repeater enhancer is struck.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Schleis makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  HUBER:  100 days, Huber with standard release conditions - CONCURRENT- Defendant already in huber custody (Milwaukee County) - this may be served in Milwaukee County.  Defendant to report to Waukesha County by 10/16/15 by 8:00 p.m. - then transfer allowed to Milwaukee County.

FINE: $1,179.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 11/2/15 or serve 28 days jail, consecutive, as penalty for non payment of fine)

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $24.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to City of Brookfiled Police Department. 

DL REVOCATION: 16 months

IGNITION INTERLOCK: 16 months

Victim Impact Panel on:  11/18/15. Defendant to serve 30 days huber, consecutive, as penalty for failure to attend Victim Impact Panel.

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH

*Defendant to provide DNA sample, immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department* 

NOTE:  Cash bail posted ($500.00) is to be returned to poster

Defendant Anthony D Felske in court, in custody, with Attorney Adam J. Schleis.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Schleis requests an adjourned date as he is still working with the state on negotiations.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  No OTP needed per Attorney Schleis.  Defendant to be returned forthwith ASAP per Attorney Schleis' request.  Hearing scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Adam J. Schleis in court.   Defendant Anthony D Felske did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Schleis advises his client is currently being housed in the MHOC.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED on amended criminal complaint.   Attorney Schleis checks defendants location confirming the defendant is still in the MHOC.    Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Milwaukee House of Correction.  Hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

Defendant Anthony D Felske in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Public Defender Intern Arial Rosenberg appears as a friend of the court.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony D Felske

Prior: 3547 E Armour Ave Unit A, Cudahy, WI 53110
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
